analysis.answer_to_prompt: This document satisfies the prompt requirements as a Brazilian employment contract under CLT (Consolidação das Leis do Trabalho). analysis.file_summary: Brazilian federal employment contract from ICMBio (Instituto Chico Mendes) for a temporary environmental firefighter position (Brigadista) dated 2020. Fixed-term 4-month contract with detailed clauses covering job duties, 40-hour work week, minimum wage salary with federal benefits, termination conditions, and application of Brazilian labor law (Lei nº 8.112/90). The contract establishes the relationship between the federal agency and an individual worker for environmental protection and fire prevention services.

title: PROCESSO: 1000063-90.2024.5.02.0032 - RECURSO DE REVISTA COM AGRAVO

analysis.answer_to_prompt: This is a Brazilian TST (Tribunal Superior do Trabalho) labor appeal document that meets the requirements. It's an "Recurso de Revista com Agravo" (appeal with grievance) from 2024, spanning 9 pages (≥3 pages). The document contains a TST process number (1000063-90.2024.5.02.0032) and is from the Brazilian labor justice system. It deals with employment law matters regarding FGTS deposits and indirect contract termination, making it suitable as the second Brazilian document needed (TST labor appeal brief).
analysis.file_summary: Brazilian TST labor appeal document (Recurso de Revista com Agravo) from 2024 addressing whether irregular FGTS deposits justify indirect contract termination under CLT article 483. The Court reaffirmed jurisprudence that FGTS irregularities constitute breach of contract justifying indirect termination without requiring immediacy. The document includes comprehensive analysis of conflicting regional court decisions and establishes binding precedent through repetitive incident mechanism.
analysis.save_instructions: Save this PDF with the filename Brazil_TST_labor_appeal_2024.pdf following the naming convention {jurisdiction}_{doc_type}_{date}.pdf where jurisdiction=Brazil, doc_type=TST_labor_appeal, and date=2024. This represents the second Brazilian document required (TST labor appeal brief).
